definition: to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to gather/to rake together/to pile up
unable to conceal one's happiness, amazement, shock etc/grinning from ear to ear/mouth agape/gobsmacked

sentences.english: Chickens also died from the lack of temperature control.
sentences.chinese: 搁有，鸡仔因为温度箱峘无法度控制嘛拢死去。

sentences.english: A confluent small-pox had in all directions flowed over his face .
sentences.chinese: 天花打四面八方汇合拢来，布满了他整个脸孔。

sentences.english: Two big fish borders to the reverse direction to the spot, probably gather together 2 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 两个大鱼际向相反方向对斑，大约拢2分钟。

sentences.english: We may not get any closer.
You just have to keep him on a tight leash.
sentences.chinese: 你要拢住他只须拉紧一根皮带。

sentences.english: the assistant will give you change. We always say a dollar note (banknote)
Nothing swaggered with a raucous noise to disarrange the perfect harmony.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何东西以粗哑刺耳的嗓音拢乱这完美的和谐。

sentences.english: The green green oat grass cover the ground.
Cowardly as ever, I shifted my hair over my right shoulder to hide my face.
sentences.chinese: 我甚至怯懦到把头发拢到右肩上垂下来，挡住我的脸。

sentences.english: His hair was over his eyebrows and he pushed it back.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发盖住了眉毛，他用手把他们拢向后面。

sentences.english: Twilight was closing on the diminished autumn day.
sentences.chinese: 秋日苦短，暮霭正在拢来。

sentences.english: They all moved towards the fire to get warm.
The cat was very angry. Every one of his whiskers stood up.
sentences.chinese: 猫是气甲逐支嘴须拢翘翘翘。

sentences.english: Long in the chest with both hands, legs received heart, wrapped himself tightly.
sentences.chinese: 双手拢在胸前，双腿收到心口，把自己裹得紧紧的。

sentences.english: On the rock, there are three little tigers. They are all their children.
sentences.chinese: 石头顶彼三只细只的拢是怹的子。

sentences.english: Her shoulder-length, ash-blond hair was fastened with a clip at the back of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 一头灰金色比肩长的头发用小发卡拢在脖颈后。

definition: to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
variant of 挽[wan3]/to draw (a cart)/to lament the dead
to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
